intro: Pinalia tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed pinyon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Pinalia tridens is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
